forecaster.strategy.debt_payment.base module¶

Provides a class for determining schedules of debt payments.

class forecaster.strategy.debt_payment.base.DebtPaymentStrategy(strategy)[source]¶

Bases: forecaster.strategy.base.Strategy

Determines payments for a group of debts.

This is simply a convenient wrapper for TransactionTraversal.

strategy¶

Either a string corresponding to a particular strategy or an instance of the strategy itself. See strategies for acceptable keys.

Type

str, func

strategies¶

{str, func} pairs where each key identifies a strategy (in human-readable text) and each value is a function with the same arguments and return value as transactions(). See its documentation for more info.

Acceptable keys include:

  • “Snowball”

  • “Avalanche”

Type

dict

Parameters

  • available (Money, dict[float, Money]) – The amounts available for repayment across all accounts, either as a single Money value (in which case accounts’ default timings are used) or as a mapping of {timing: value} pairs where positive values are treated as inflows usable as repayments.

  • debts (list) – Debts to repay.

Returns

A mapping of debts to transactions.

Return type

dict[Debt, dict[Decimal, Money]]

__call__(debts, available, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Returns a dict of {account, Money} pairs.

strategies = {'Avalanche': <function DebtPaymentStrategy.strategy_avalanche>, 'Snowball': <function DebtPaymentStrategy.strategy_snowball>}
strategy_avalanche(debts, available, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Pays off the highest-interest debt first.

strategy_snowball(debts, available, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Pays off the smallest debt first.
